sentences.en: Calamity is man's true touch stone.
sentences.cn: 灾祸是吾人真正的试金石.

sentences.en: Even a greater natural calamity cannot daunt us.
sentences.cn: 再大的自然灾害也压不垮我们.

sentences.en: For me, the July twentieth affair was in every way a calamity.
sentences.cn: 就我来说, 七月二十日事件完全是大祸临头.

sentences.en: He described drugs as the greatest calamity of the age.
sentences.cn: 他称毒品是这个时代最大的祸害。

sentences.en: He gave the money to the victims of a natural calamity in order to crown his father's wish.
sentences.cn: 他把这笔钱捐给灾民,以遂其父的心愿.

sentences.en: His becoming blind was a great calamity.
sentences.cn: 他双目失明是巨大的不幸.

sentences.en: If we had been careful such a calamity would not have befallen us.
sentences.cn: 假如我们谨慎的话,这种灾难不会降临到我们的头上.

sentences.en: It could only end in calamity.
sentences.cn: 它只会落得个灾难性的下场。

sentences.en: It will be a calamity for farmers if the crops fail again.
sentences.cn: 如果再次歉收，将会给农民带来灾难。

sentences.en: The frost last week was a great calamity to the citrus industry.
sentences.cn: 上周的霜冻对柑橘种植业是一场大灾难.

sentences.en: The recent flooding in the south was a calamity.
sentences.cn: 最近南方的洪水是一场灾难.

sentences.en: They have issued the calamity - stricken people with food.
They supposed that some calamity had befallen the Governor.
sentences.cn: 他们心想这位先生一定遇到了什么无妄之灾.

sentences.en: This is the way to keep off every calamity of life.
sentences.cn: 这是防止住生命中灾难的办法.

trans.tran_cn: 灾祸，灾难，不幸之事，困苦，不幸
trans.tran_en: a terrible and unexpected event that causes a lot of damage or suffering
